name: 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3893
Reason: The basic unit for this molecule is 1,3-dioxane, which has a melting point of approximately -20°C. The furyl group (C4H4) in the molecule contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and the presence of aromatic rings, which can increase the melting point by approximately +100 to +150 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group (C6H5) also contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and the presence of aromatic rings, which can increase the melting point by approximately +100 to +150 degrees Celsius. The methyl groups (CH3) in the molecule can lower the melting point due to their small size and the disruption of crystalline packing, which can lead to a decrease in the melting point. Considering the effects of the furyl and phenyl groups, a net increase in the melting point is estimated.
